intro: Blepharis gueinzi, commonly known as the Cape fennel, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is often found in coastal areas. Its leaves are narrow and slightly hairy, while its flowers range in color from white to pink. Blepharis gueinzi is often used in traditional medicine and is also valued for its ornamental appeal.
